sn56.57:4.1: “Mendicants, suppose a man was to draw up two or three drops of water from the ocean.
sn56.57:4.2: What do you think, mendicants? Which is more: the two or three drops drawn out or the water in the ocean?”
sn56.57:4.4: “Sir, the water in the ocean is certainly more.
sn56.57:4.6: The two or three drops drawn out are tiny.
sn56.57:4.7: Compared to the water in the ocean, it can’t be reckoned or compared, it’s not even a fraction.”
sn56.57:4.8: “In the same way, for a noble disciple …
sn56.57:4.9: That’s why you should practice meditation …”
